required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Simvastatin With Guided Bone Regeneration in Ridge Splitting and Simultaneously Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Simvastatin With Guided Bone Regeneration on Ridge Volume in Ridge Splitting and Simultaneously Implantation: a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Ridge split augmentation technique, with immediate implant placement, reduces the time of the treatment and the time of the final prosthetic reconstruction. Furthermore, compression of the bone increases its density. SMV is also found to promote osteogenic differentiation of bone marrow stem cells, suppress osteoclastic differentiation in bone tissue, and promotes osseointegration around implants in animal studies. The aim of this study is to compare surgical outcomes of the application of the alveolar ridge splitting (ARS) in combination with guided bone regeneration (GBR) using bone grafting and a barrier membrane, associated with immediate implant placement versus ARS in combination with the use of SMV with GBR using bone grafting and a barrier membrane, associated with immediate implant placement in patients with horizontally atrophic jaw bones.

primary_outcome.measure: Measurements of the amount of bone formation in millimeters around immediately placed dental implants
primary_outcome.description: Measurements of the amount of bone formation in millimeters using GBR with or without the combined effect of SMV in the ridge splitting following immediate implant placement.

arm_group.description: alveolar ridge splitting in combination with the use of GBR with SMV with immediate implant placement
alveolar ridge splitting in combination with the use of GBR without SMV with immediate implant placement

intervention.intervention_name: Immediate implant placement and ARS with GBR and SMV
intervention.description: Implant insertion and GBR for augmentation of the gap between buccal and lingual plate using bone graft mixed with SMV

intervention.intervention_name: Immediate implant placement and ARS with GBR
intervention.description: Implant insertion and GBR for augmentation of the gap between buccal and lingual plate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- good general health at the time of surgery.
- at least 3 months of healing after tooth extraction.
- horizontally compromised alveolar ridges at least 10 mm high and 3 mm wide.
Exclusion Criteria:
- a vertical bone defect in the edentulous ridge.
- thick cortex in the labial/buccal with less cancellous bone inside
- obvious undercut on the labial/buccal side.
- uncontrolled periodontal conditions or other oral disorders.
- history of radiotherapy in the head and neck region.
- uncontrolled diabetes mellitus or other systematic disorders.
- smokers.
- Pregnancy.
- non-compliant patients.
- allergic reaction to the medications used.
